string.text: Halt, stalker. You can't go further!
And why that?

Farther lies our territory - the base of Duty faction. And we're indeed eager to find a quarrel in the straw when choosing the ones to let into our residence. If you \nhave no significant deals with our leaders, we are not letting you in.
Okay, I'm gonna go. For now. But I'll be back!
Please, do. Any time day and night.
I have business with the barkeep. I believe you know him?
Even if I do, the pass costs a sum. Shell out half a grand and we'll let you in. Or you can render us some service. Choose.
I'll better give you money then.
Perfect, now pass, and you'd better have a really important business to the barkeep. But there is quite a number of anomalies in the passageway, stay cautious.
What kind of service?
Hah, trifles in general. There is a boar nest nearby. It would be nice if someone cleared it away. I'll show you its location. Clear it and consider the due to be paid.
Deal. I'm gonna switch to the hunt now, make a toast of dairy boar.
Good luck, stalker.
What if I go and make some money.
Yeah, you might find empty bottles right here at the garbage, collect them, maybe you'll make enough money.
So, how are the boars doing?
Doing... still.
When you start undoing them, bring me some toast please.
Sorry, all toastes were spent, by me.
Wag, darn... Alright, you may pass, but be sure that I'll carry you this toast back.
When you see the barkeep, send my greetings to him. Oh, and dont forget about lots of anomalies in the passage, be careful.
Can you tell anything about the Garbage?

Well, there is nothing special in here. Garbage like any other garbage. The northern road to the "Bar" is guarded by the "Duty"'s militants. You'd better stay away 
from dealing with them, Duty has got many obscure guys in it. To the right - passages to the Dark Valley, but there is a really fierce radiation there. Little bit closer - 
"Grimpen Mire", swamps full of anomalies. It's said that it can be useful in finding artifacts, but it definitely can help in finding troubles. The only thing is settled - at 
least there is no hound of the baskervilles on the bogs.
Maybe you know anything else?
Interesting information, thanks, I'll consider it.

Well, one more point. There is a cache to the right, where the bogs lie. When you see the metal edifice, which streches above one of the puddles. Anyway, right \nunder it you'll find the cache. I'd hidden it in my time, but you saved my life and I think, you require it more than I do. So use it on your own.
Thanks, mate. I won't forget it.
Thanks, my friend, you've helped me a lot. I'll remember that.
Next time try to avoid such scraps. You'll save your nerves and my bullets.
Until you are taken ill with sclerosis. I know, I know. Well, so long.

It's not as easy as it may seem to be. My friends are waiting now for the bandits' raid nearby, so as to stop them. If the bandits manage to obtain control over this \ngarbage, nobody will have the access to the center of the Zone. I'm struggling for the stalkers' future. Talk to our commander, he has settled close by the \ngraveyard with his soldiers. I'm gonna visit him, join me.
Hem... Get him, Superman in the diapers. Save yourself first of all.
Oh, cut the crap. Anyone could be caught on the way like this.
Hi, glad to see you.
Likewise.
Hello to you too. You need help as far as I understand?

Desperately need it. Bandit gang is trying to gain control over the Garbage. Half an hour ago there was a brawl here. We did in three of the bastards. The rest of 
the gangsters retreated, but are likely to return with reinforcements any minute. We are few, so any extra barrel would come in handy. If you help us eliminate their 
reinforcements, I will repay as due.
Okay, I'm gonna stretch my legs before the long walk...
Perfect. We'll make an ambush, so you stay away of firing too soon. They'll approach from the Agroprom direction, westerly. And don't try to kick the pricks.
I'll act under the circumstances.
This is not my business and I won't risk my butt.
As you want, but you'll be whipping the cat, when paying the due to the freaks.
Let me deal with this myself.
Fear not, old man. I have spoiled them a bit. So the reinforcement can reinforce only dead ranks.
Oh, you are cool. But I'll better secure myself. What of it.
Good luck there.
What say you, old man?
When I have free time, I'll be happy to help you with your business. People like you don't wander for no reason. Besides I know quite enough and can share \nsome info.
Information is good, but you cannot feed on it alone. And besides, I could well do with some healing, buy up some ammo and so forth.\n
I can pay with money, you will make use of it. Here you go, right for your healing.
Now we are talking. Consider us settled.
No, thanks, this battle is mine.
Do as you want, but I won't be waiting for you for the whole life, you must be not a fair maiden.
Guess I'm not seeking marriage with you. See you, old man.
Tell me about yourself at first.

I'm Damon. I've come here three years ago. As the majority in here - I'm the runaway. I've got two murders and heavy bodity on my back. Several years ago my 
friend has been maliciously hammered in the outside region. He has been gathered by particles in the resuscitation unit. Hence we had to make a visit of gratitude. 
When the cops zoomed up to arrest me, I had to croak one of them and jump off the second floor. Since then I wander in there. Yet my collection of articles on the 
back has been decently increased. And here I struggle with the chaos as I can. As at the Big Land. Train and organize the youth, teach them how to survive.
Why aren't you joining the Duty with these humanistic gospels?

The Duty is struggling against the Zone, while I'm struggling for humans. Besides, they're closely connected with our government and army. I'm not burning with the \ndesire to wake up in the detention cell in one shiny morning.
Well good luck to you, crusader.
What kind of place is that?

Garbage. Place, where we'll find the righteous place for us. Do you see the piles of trash? You'd better not wander there, there are radioactive wastes, Geiger's 
counter trills away like a nightingale. Here is the only convinient passage into the center of the Zone. And recently bandits started to take advantage over this 
territory. Farther, whereto the experienced stalkers roam, is the Duty's territory, they are afraid to poke in there. While bozing here, shagging out the novices - 
common cause. Though if anyone don't care a damn about this, we'll have to take up arms once again.
Yeah, I see you need it the most.
No, this is called the life stand point. You'll have to remain humanlike everywhere, and especially here, trying not to be brute with the only goal of the craving of \nbean.
Oh come on, I didn't want to offend you.
Good, old man, and what else can you tell me about the Garbage?

There is a large abandoned hangar in the center, and it's pretty quiet there. At the worst you may spend the night there. If you go to the West, in the direction of \nAgroprom you'll find the bandits camp, whence those freaks were comming, but I believe that it's not the end.
Oh, thanks, this information is right enough to start working.
Thanks, we don't need anything from you.
Greetings to you, stalker. You're right on time.
I have nothing to do with you.
As you wish.
Thank you, friend, you've helped us. How are you?
The business is still undone, leave the talks for the later.
Hello.
Friend, help me. Please!
And what happened?

My friend and I located a nice place with artefacts here. We went on a couple of times in this tunnel to bring back a decent loot. But lately bandits have \nencamped here, we dropped into the tunnel to find hiding there. After the Blowout though many anomalies showed up and my friend got entrapped in anomaly \nthere, inside the tunnel. And now I cannot make it out, there are bandits there, while sitting here is a certain death. Stalker, help out, I'll be grateful for ages.
Well, fancy I agree to help. What this help will be about?
Pick off the bandits on entrance, and I'll make it fine back home on my own.
Alright, if you can't protect yourself on your own, I will do it. Sit still and don't move until I call you.
They are a feed for crows now. So you may well stroll back home safe.
Sorry, buddy, I'm too busy today. Can't help really.
Oh how I wish I could make it to a safe place shortly.

I'll make it on my own from this point on. I can't imagine what to thank you with really. Here grab the money, unfortunately that's all I have with me. But life costs \nmore. Should you need something from me - feel free to ask.
You didn't disappoint me. Be good. Never cough and stay away from the night Zone at full moon, when the forces of evil enjoy complete domination.
It doesn't seem there are other forces to reign here at any other time. Alright, thanks, I'll make it on my own from here.
Gesundheit, so to say! Glad to see you in one piece.
Thanks, likewise.
Well now have you got time to talk down calmly?
Yes, for the time being. Wherefrom have you poked out?
I've been talking to Fox recently. He says that you've got information on the Gunslinger's grouping.

Well supposedly, but considering yor almost gratuitous help I'll tell you. I'll be awaited by one of the guys, former Digger, called Mole. He has digged out the 
Gunslinger's cahce and took out to the light the documents, which enlighten many things. But inasmuch as he got bandits chasing him on his back, he didn't take 
the documents with him - only remembered the place. But as I'm hunted now, I'll preferably go into shadow now. Take these coordinates of the meeting and tell 
him that you're from me. This flash-drive has also got some materials in it.
Thanks. Your grey bacon has been saved not in vain. Good luck, stalker.
Ok, I'll wait right here, my comrades will be here soon.
Darn it, cut the crap. You'll find only the bullets here talking to you. Help us to defend ourselves and then we'll probably have a chat.
Gosh, that was hot.
Hi, mate, there has been a nice gaiety in here, damn it.
Find your path by the anomalies through the artifacts, stalker-boy.
Buzz off, buddy, the war is blooming!
Listen, buddy, what's interesting to be found on this dump here?

Ass-kicking troubles galore here. But if you are so full of pioneer's zeal, listen here. To the east there is a small forest, there's nothing interesting there, however 
packs of dogs frequent there. Be careful. If you follow these rails, they will lead you to a tunnel. Many anomalies are there, maybe there's something interesting left 
there, I don't know, I didn't explore it thoroughly. I think you know about the army post of Duty in the north. That's basically it of what I know about this level.
Thanks, this has been helpful, will take into account.
Can you tell me anything about this place?

Well listen then. We're now located at the huge stinky garbage dump. Since 1986 it has been the place to store the radioactive trash, cranes, worn out machinery. 
In general the trash is all way around you, besides there is quite a number of anomalies among the debris. Artifacts appear, although not superior enough. That's 
why it is the place mainly dedicated for the novices. And hence the novices bring bandits with them. So you'd better not stay here for long. There are lots of 
radioactive hotbeds to the East, going here without the protection suits can be fatal. If you proceed to the South, you'll exit to the border of the Zone. If North - 
you'll find the abandoned Rostok factory, and stalkers' bar in it. Dark Valley to the East - dark, gloomy and foggy place. Agroprom research institute to the West. I'll 
mark the spots on the map for, to make you path more safely.
Don't kill me, stalker, I beg you. I'm feeling awful as I am.
Well it depends on what you can be useful with. For example, what is this pilgrimage from Egypt, pshaw, I meant Agroprom, for?

We got the base firstly at Agroprom... then we heard the stir that "epaulets" are going to visit it. Someone went to the Dark Valley, but many has stayed here. Well, 
to think narrowly, they'll make a ransack and go away. But more was coming. They haven't merely come, but arrived at APCs. At that they've made a really 
thoroughgoing cleaning, perhaps desired to supply their retirement. Lots of you guys has been slaughtered. They were just shooting off everyone they see. There 
was a group of neutrals - even they were exterminated. They've organized a base there and it produced an impression that the institute had as an important 
meaning as it was worth eliminating the whole city.
Hmm, interesting news. Okay, just relax here for a while. Brute death to the brute.
Some day you'll find your deathbed too. And will also beg for help. I wish I could see this.
